CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Master essential security principles and practices before diving into specific domains like network and cloud security.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Understand core security principles: Confidentiality, Integrity, and Availability.

Confidentiality.What to Study: Encryption algorithms (AES, RSA), access control models (DAC, MAC, RBAC), and data obfuscation.
Confidentiality.Practical Project: Encrypt data using GPG or OpenSSL. Implement RBAC in Linux using sudo and user roles.

Integrity.What to Study: Hashing algorithms (SHA, MD5), digital signatures, and file integrity monitoring.
Integrity.Practical Project: Monitor file integrity with Tripwire or AIDE and simulate integrity breaches.

Availability.What to Study: Redundancy, backups, disaster recovery, and availability in cloud environments.
Availability.Practical Project: Simulate a DoS attack with hping3 and configure `fail2ban` to mitigate it.

Security Models.What to Study: Bell-LaPadula, Biba, and Clark-Wilson models for ensuring confidentiality and integrity.
Security Models.Practical Project: Implement Bell-LaPadula's mandatory access control using SELinux on a Linux system.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Identify, assess, and manage security risks.

Risk Identification.What to Study: Understand operational, compliance, and reputational risks in an organization.
Risk Identification.Practical Project: Perform risk identification on a small network using Nmap.

Risk Assessment.What to Study: Conduct qualitative and quantitative risk assessments.
Risk Assessment.Practical Project: Model threats and assess vulnerabilities using OWASP Threat Dragon.

Risk Mitigation.What to Study: Study mitigation strategies: risk avoidance, transference, and acceptance.
Risk Mitigation.Practical Project: Implement security controls like firewalls and intrusion detection/prevention systems.

Risk Monitoring.What to Study: Ongoing risk monitoring and response plans.
Risk Monitoring.Practical Project: Use a SIEM tool like Splunk to continuously monitor security risks.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Ensure correct identity verification and authorization mechanisms.

Authentication.What to Study: Password-based, MFA, and public key infrastructure (PKI).
Authentication.Practical Project: Configure SSH server for public key authentication and implement MFA.

Authorization.What to Study: Access control models and enforcing authorization policies.
Authorization.Practical Project: Implement RBAC in Django/Flask for web applications.

Accounting.What to Study: Log user activities, audit trails, and track system access.
Accounting.Practical Project: Configure `auditd` to monitor system logins and sensitive file access.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Study encryption, decryption, and cryptographic attacks.

Symmetric Encryption.What to Study: AES, DES, and 3DES algorithms and key management.
Symmetric Encryption.Practical Project: Encrypt and decrypt files using AES in OpenSSL.

Asymmetric Encryption.What to Study: RSA, ECC, public/private key pairs, digital signatures.
Asymmetric Encryption.Practical Project: Generate RSA keys and encrypt/decrypt data with OpenSSL.

Hashing Algorithms.What to Study: SHA-256, SHA-3, and their use in data integrity.
Hashing Algorithms.Practical Project: Create a Python file integrity checker using the hashlib library.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Strengthen Linux security skills crucial for a Security Engineer.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Master Linux user, group management, and access controls.

User and Group Permissions.What to Study: Linux user management, file permissions, and ACLs.
User and Group Permissions.Practical Project: Create and manage users, implement ACLs for file-level access.

Privilege Escalation.What to Study: How attackers escalate privileges in Linux systems.
Privilege Escalation.Practical Project: Simulate privilege escalation attacks in a Linux environment and implement mitigations.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Learn Mandatory Access Control using SELinux and AppArmor.

SELinux Basics.What to Study: SELinux policies, contexts, and enforcing security rules.
SELinux Basics.Practical Project: Enable and configure SELinux in enforcing mode, create custom policies.

AppArmor.What to Study: Learn how AppArmor restricts application behavior.
AppArmor.Practical Project: Set up and configure AppArmor for process isolation on Ubuntu.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Secure Linux-based network services and firewalls.

iptables/nftables.What to Study: Linux firewall basics, configuring iptables and nftables.
iptables/nftables.Practical Project: Set up iptables and transition to nftables for a server.

SSH Hardening.What to Study: Securing SSH with key-based authentication, port knocking, and fail2ban.
SSH Hardening.Practical Project: Harden SSH access using key-based login, and set up fail2ban to block brute-force attempts.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Cloud security is vital for Security Engineers in modern infrastructures.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Control access to cloud resources effectively.

AWS IAM.What to Study: Least privilege, roles, policies, and MFA in AWS IAM.
AWS IAM.Practical Project: Set up least privilege roles and enforce MFA for an AWS environment.

Azure IAM.What to Study: Manage users, groups, and roles in Azure Active Directory.
Azure IAM.Practical Project: Set up role-based access control (RBAC) in Azure.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Protect cloud infrastructures from unauthorized access.

AWS VPC Security.What to Study: VPCs, security groups, and network ACLs in AWS.
AWS VPC Security.Practical Project: Create a VPC and secure subnets with security groups and NACLs.

Azure Network Security.What to Study: Azure Network Security Groups (NSGs), VNets, and DDoS protection.
Azure Network Security.Practical Project: Set up a secure Azure Virtual Network with NSGs and DDoS protection.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Prepare for and respond to cybersecurity incidents.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Respond effectively to security breaches.

Incident Response Phases.What to Study: Preparation, detection, containment, eradication, recovery, lessons learned.
Incident Response Phases.Practical Project: Develop an incident response plan and simulate a ransomware attack response.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Collect and analyze digital evidence post-breach.

Forensic Analysis Tools.What to Study: Autopsy, FTK Imager, and Sleuth Kit.
Forensic Analysis Tools.Practical Project: Analyze a compromised system for malware and recover deleted files.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Implement Zero Trust principles to reduce attack surfaces.

Zero Trust Implementation.Practical Project: Implement a Zero Trust network using Okta for identity management and firewalls for micro-segmentation.

TOPICS.TOPIC: AI and Machine Learning in Security
TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Leverage AI/ML for threat detection and prevention.

Anomaly Detection.What to Study: Use machine learning models for anomaly detection in network traffic.
Anomaly Detection.Practical Project: Train a simple anomaly detection model using scikit-learn and apply it to real network logs.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Focus on Linux hardening, advanced networking, firewalling, and securing containers.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Securing the Linux system beyond basic configurations.

Kernel Hardening.What to Study: Use sysctl for kernel parameter security, apply patches.
Kernel Hardening.Practical Project: Harden kernel settings and audit system logs using `auditd`.

Advanced Logging.What to Study: Log auditing, rotation, and analysis using journald, rsyslog, and logwatch.
Advanced Logging.Practical Project: Set up centralized logging using rsyslog and automate log analysis with custom scripts.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Set up robust firewall rules using nftables.

Connection Tracking and Logging.What to Study: nftables connection tracking and advanced logging.
Connection Tracking and Logging.Practical Project: Create firewall rules for a server to log and filter traffic based on connection state.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Deep dive into networking protocols and diagnostics.

Packet Analysis.What to Study: Analyze traffic using tcpdump and Wireshark.
Packet Analysis.Practical Project: Capture and analyze network traffic to find bottlenecks or security breaches.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Secure containerized applications with Docker, cgroups, and namespaces.

Container Security.What to Study: Docker security practices, container isolation using namespaces.
Container Security.Practical Project: Build secure Docker containers and audit their security using Docker Bench.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Advanced cloud security practices, IAM, and secure networking.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Secure cloud resources with AWS IAM, Azure IAM, and best practices.

AWS IAM Advanced Practices.What to Study: Learn about policies, roles, and MFA.
AWS IAM Advanced Practices.Practical Project: Create and enforce IAM policies with least privilege.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Secure DNS configurations in cloud and on-prem environments.

DNSSEC and Hardening.What to Study: Understand DNSSEC, securing DNS against attacks.
DNSSEC and Hardening.Practical Project: Set up DNSSEC on a DNS server and configure it for secure queries.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Develop skills in penetration testing and offensive security to strengthen defensive strategies.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Learn to find vulnerabilities in web applications.

SQL Injection and XSS.What to Study: Explore OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, including SQL injection and cross-site scripting (XSS).
SQL Injection and XSS.Practical Project: Test for SQL injection on a vulnerable web app like DVWA. Use Burp Suite to automate scans and find XSS.

Authentication Flaws.Practical Project: Simulate a brute-force attack using Hydra on a login form and mitigate it.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Test cloud environments for vulnerabilities and misconfigurations.

AWS Penetration Testing.What to Study: Learn about misconfigured IAM roles, public S3 buckets, and exposed cloud services.
AWS Penetration Testing.Practical Project: Perform penetration testing on AWS using tools like ScoutSuite and Pacu to identify misconfigurations.

Azure Penetration Testing.What to Study: Test Azure-based environments for security gaps in VNets, Azure AD, and storage accounts.
Azure Penetration Testing.Practical Project: Set up a lab environment in Azure and test it for common vulnerabilities using Azure's Security Center.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Learn how to write exploits to understand vulnerabilities in-depth.

Buffer Overflows.What to Study: Learn buffer overflow attacks and how to develop simple exploits.
Buffer Overflows.Practical Project: Write a buffer overflow exploit for a vulnerable C program using GDB and Immunity Debugger.

Return-Oriented Programming (ROP).What to Study: Advanced exploit techniques using ROP chains.
Return-Oriented Programming (ROP).Practical Project: Develop a ROP-based exploit on a vulnerable Linux application.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Master forensic techniques to investigate incidents and prevent further damage.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Analyze network traffic to identify malicious activities.

Packet Capture Analysis.What to Study: Learn to analyze network packets using tcpdump, Wireshark, and Zeek.
Packet Capture Analysis.Practical Project: Capture and analyze network traffic in a simulated incident scenario to detect anomalies.

DNS and HTTP Analysis.What to Study: Examine DNS tunneling and HTTP-based attacks.
DNS and HTTP Analysis.Practical Project: Analyze DNS traffic to identify tunneling activity and simulate an HTTP-based attack using Burp Suite.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Investigate Linux-based attacks using specialized tools.

Log and File System Analysis.What to Study: Learn to analyze logs, file metadata, and changes in file systems.
Log and File System Analysis.Practical Project: Use tools like `Autopsy`, `Sleuth Kit`, and `log2timeline` to analyze a compromised Linux server.

Memory Forensics.What to Study: Analyze memory dumps to find malware and active connections.
Memory Forensics.Practical Project: Capture memory using `volatility` and extract artifacts from an infected Linux machine.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Forensically investigate incidents in cloud environments.

AWS Forensics.What to Study: Investigate compromised AWS accounts and services.
AWS Forensics.Practical Project: Use AWS CloudTrail logs to investigate a security incident, including unauthorized access to S3 buckets.

Azure Forensics.What to Study: Analyze Azure logs for signs of a breach in the cloud environment.
Azure Forensics.Practical Project: Investigate an incident using Azure Sentinel, focusing on log analysis and alerting.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Learn advanced techniques to defend against sophisticated cyber attacks.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Detect and mitigate threats through real-time traffic monitoring.

SIEM and IDS Integration.What to Study: Integrate intrusion detection systems (IDS) with a SIEM for advanced monitoring.
SIEM and IDS Integration.Practical Project: Set up Suricata with ELK or Splunk and write detection rules to identify malicious network traffic.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Collaborate between offensive and defensive teams to strengthen security.

Adversary Simulation.What to Study: Simulate attacks and test the effectiveness of defensive controls.
Adversary Simulation.Practical Project: Use MITRE ATT&CK to simulate a cyber attack and create a report on the defensive gaps found.

Red-Blue Team Collaboration.What to Study: Collaborate between red and blue teams to improve detection and response.
Red-Blue Team Collaboration.Practical Project: Simulate an attack in a controlled environment and collaborate with a blue team to harden the environment.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Secure cloud environments and automate security tasks.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Automate security tasks to enhance cloud defense.

Automating Cloud Threat Detection.What to Study: Learn to automate security tasks such as auditing, monitoring, and compliance.
Automating Cloud Threat Detection.Practical Project: Set up automated monitoring and alerting using AWS Config, AWS Lambda, and GuardDuty.

CATEGORIES.DESCRIPTION: Deep-dive into niche and emerging cybersecurity topics.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Explore the security of blockchain and smart contracts.

Smart Contract Auditing.What to Study: Learn to audit smart contracts for vulnerabilities.
Smart Contract Auditing.Practical Project: Audit a simple smart contract for vulnerabilities using tools like Mythril.

TOPICS.DESCRIPTION: Leverage machine learning for threat detection and prevention.

Anomaly Detection Using ML.What to Study: Use machine learning models to detect network anomalies.
Anomaly Detection Using ML.Practical Project: Train an anomaly detection model using Python and scikit-learn, then apply it to real network traffic.
